name: White Port & Tonic
method: Fill a glass with ice.
Pour in the White Port.
Top up with tonic water.
Stir gently and garnish with a lime wedge.
tastingNotes: light, refreshing, and subtly sweet with citrusy undertones.

name: Aperol Spritz
method: Fill a glass with ice.
Add the Aperol.
Pour in the prosecco.
Top up with soda water.
Stir gently and garnish with an orange slice.
tastingNotes: bittersweet, bubbly, and perfect for a summer afternoon.

name: Gin & Tonic
method: Fill a glass with ice.
Pour in the gin.
Top up with tonic water.
Stir gently and garnish with a lime wedge.
tastingNotes: crisp, refreshing, and aromatic with a hint of citrus.

name: White Port Negroni
method: Fill a mixing glass with ice.
Add the White Port, gin, and Martini Blanco.
Stir well and strain into a glass filled with ice.
Garnish with an orange twist if desired.
tastingNotes: complex, bittersweet, and herbaceous with a smooth finish.

name: Gin Fizz
method: Fill a shaker with ice.
Add the gin, sugar syrup, and lemon juice.
Shake well and strain into a glass filled with ice.
Top up with soda water and stir gently.

name: Kahlua Iced Coffee
method: Fill a glass with ice.
Pour in the Kahlua and espresso.
Add milk or cream to taste.
Stir gently.
tastingNotes: creamy, rich, and deeply satisfying with a pronounced coffee flavour.

name: White Port Martini
method: Fill a shaker with ice.
Add the White Port and Martini Blanco.
Shake well and strain into a chilled martini glass.
Garnish with a lemon twist.
tastingNotes: elegant, smooth, and slightly sweet with a touch of citrus.

name: Cassis Gin Smash
method: Muddle the mint leaves and lime juice in a shaker.
Fill the shaker with ice.
Add the gin and Creme de Cassis.
Shake well and strain into a glass filled with ice.
Garnish with additional mint leaves.
tastingNotes: fruity, vibrant, and refreshingly sweet with a minty finish.

name: Tropical Balsam Spritz
method: Fill a glass with ice.
Pour in the Riga Balsam Tropical.
Top up with soda water.
Stir gently and garnish with a lime wedge.

name: French 75
method: Fill a shaker with ice.
Add the gin, lemon juice, and sugar syrup.
Shake well and strain into a champagne flute.
Top up with prosecco.
Stir gently and garnish with a lemon twist.
tastingNotes: crisp, effervescent, and elegantly refreshing with a citrusy sparkle.
